verses.plain: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

tokens.t: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

verses.plain: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

tokens.t: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

verses.plain: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

tokens.t: My words
the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

verses.plain: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

tokens.t: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

verses.plain: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

tokens.t: If thou canst answer me, set
in order before me, stand up.

verses.plain: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

tokens.t: Behold, I
according to thy wish in God’s stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

verses.plain: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

tokens.t: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

verses.plain: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

tokens.t: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of
words,

verses.plain: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

tokens.t: I am clean without transgression, I
innocent; neither
iniquity in me.

verses.plain: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

tokens.t: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

verses.plain: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

tokens.t: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

verses.plain: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

tokens.t: Behold,
this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

verses.plain: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

tokens.t: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

verses.plain: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

tokens.t: For God speaketh once, yea twice,
perceiveth it not.

verses.plain: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

tokens.t: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

verses.plain: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

tokens.t: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

verses.plain: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

tokens.t: That he may withdraw man
purpose, and hide pride from man.

verses.plain: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

tokens.t: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

verses.plain: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

tokens.t: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong

verses.plain: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

tokens.t: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

verses.plain: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

tokens.t: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones
were not seen stick out.

verses.plain: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

tokens.t: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

verses.plain: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

tokens.t: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

verses.plain: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

tokens.t: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

verses.plain: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:

tokens.t: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s: he shall return to the days of his youth:

verses.plain: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

tokens.t: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

verses.plain: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

tokens.t: He looketh upon men, and
say, I have sinned, and perverted
right, and it profited me not;

verses.plain: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

tokens.t: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

verses.plain: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

tokens.t: Lo, all these
worketh God oftentimes with man,

verses.plain: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

tokens.t: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

verses.plain: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

tokens.t: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

verses.plain: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

tokens.t: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

verses.plain: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

tokens.t: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

footnotes.text: in my mouth: Heb. in my palate
he giveth…: Heb. he answereth not
he…: Heb. he revealeth, or, uncovereth
He…: or, He shall look upon men, and say
He…: or, He hath delivered my soul, etc, and my life
